metadata.case_name: Namdeorao Baliramji & Mahadeo Paikaji Kolhe v. State of Bombay

facts.text: Two writ petitions filed under Art. 32 of the Constitution challenging the validity of the Bombay Tenancy and Agricultural Lands Act 99 of 1958.
The impugned Act extends provisions of the Bombay Tenancy and Agricultural Lands Amendment Act, 1956 (Act XIII of 1956) to Vidarbha region and Cutch area in the State of Bombay.
Namdeorao Baliramji owns about 80 acres dry lands in Amraoti, out of which 43 acres under personal cultivation and rest in possession of tenants.
Mahadeo Paikaji Kolhe owns about 1168 acres dry lands in Yeotmal, out of which 400 acres under personal cultivation and rest with tenants.
Lands of both petitioners are charged to the payment of land revenue.

Validity of Bombay Act XIII of 1956 upheld in Sri Ram Ram Narain Medhi v. State of Bombay as constitutional and protected by Art. 31A(2)(a), where lands were estates per s. 2(5) Bombay Land Revenue Code, 1879.
Existing local law is Madhya Pradesh Land Revenue Code, 1954.

legal_issues.text: Whether the lands belonging to the petitioners are an estate within the meaning of Art. 31A(2)(a), such that the impugned Act is protected by Art. 31A.

petitioner_arguments.text: The lands belonging to the two petitioners are not an estate within the meaning of Art. 31A(2)(a), and so the impugned Act is outside the protection of Art. 31A.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Art. 31A(2)(a); Madhya Pradesh Land Revenue Code, 1954

court_reasoning.text: Art. 31A(2)(a) provides that 'estate' shall have the same meaning as in existing law relating to land tenures or its local equivalent; under Madhya Pradesh Land Revenue Code, 1954, s.27 defines holding, s.145-146 define tenure-holders as Bhumiswami/Bhumidhari including occupants in Berar, making such land the local equivalent of estate.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Petitioners hold lands under the State, pay land revenue; thus lands fall within local equivalents of 'estate' under Art. 31A(2)(a).

court_reasoning.text: The word 'estate' as such not used in Madhya Pradesh Code, but Art. 31A(2)(a) includes local equivalents; impugned Act definitions of 'land' (s.2(17)) and 'land-holder' (s.2(18)) relevant but determination under local revenue code dispositive.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Previous decision on 1956 Act followed; if Art. 31A applies, no further challenge possible.

holdings.text: Lands held by petitioners are local equivalent of 'estate' under Art. 31A(2)(a) per Madhya Pradesh Land Revenue Code; impugned Act protected by Art. 31A and valid.

precedents_cited.case_name: Sri Ram Ram Narain Medhi v. State of Bombay
precedents_cited.relevance: Upheld Bombay Act XIII of 1956 as constitutional under Art. 31A(2)(a) applying 'estate' definition from Bombay Land Revenue Code s.2(5).

statutes_cited.name: Bombay Tenancy and Agricultural Lands Act, 1958
statutes_cited.relevance: Impugned Act extending 1956 provisions to Vidarbha/Cutch; definitions of land and land-holder.

statutes_cited.name: Bombay Tenancy and Agricultural Lands Amendment Act, 1956
statutes_cited.relevance: Provisions extended by 1958 Act; previously upheld constitutional.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Basis for writ petitions; protection for impugned Act.

statutes_cited.name: Madhya Pradesh Land Revenue Code, 1954
statutes_cited.relevance: Existing local law defining holding, tenure-holders (Bhumiswami/Bhumidhari); local equivalent of 'estate'.

statutes_cited.name: Bombay Land Revenue Code, 1879
statutes_cited.relevance: Definition of 'estate' applied in prior case to 1956 Act.

outcome.summary: Writ petitions dismissed as lands of petitioners constitute local equivalent of 'estate' under Art. 31A(2)(a) per Madhya Pradesh Land Revenue Code; impugned Act protected and valid; no need to consider other contentions.

key_quotes.text: the lands held by them fall within the class of the local equivalents of the word estate as contemplated by Art. 31A(2)(a). If that is so the contention raised by Mr. Limaye that the impugned Act is not protected by Art. 31A cannot succeed.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core holding rejecting petitioners' claim and upholding Act.

key_quotes.text: It was realised that in many areas the existing law relating to land tenures may not expressly define an estate as such though the said areas had their local equivalents described and defined.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Explains constitutional intent of Art. 31A(2)(a) including local equivalents.
